intro: Cistanthe monandra, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Cistanthe monandra is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
